intro: Cliffortia dodecandra, commonly known as the twelve-branch tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is known for its distinctive, branched structure and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Cliffortia dodecandra is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in coastal areas, adapting well to harsh, nutrient-poor environments.
